column2: High Volume: High sales frequency increases the probability of typing errors and theft masking.
Name Confusion: Common antibiotic often abbreviated ("Azithro", "Azi") or confused with 250mg variants.
High Frequency: Frequently prescribed, leading to "autopilot" data entry errors by staff.

column3: Map: Standardize to Master. Coach: "Always type 650."
Map: Standardize. Flag: Unusual variant; check if this is a sub-brand.
Map: Standardize. Flag: Critical missing dosage (500 vs 250).

column5: CRITICAL: High variance (-2%). Check for theft or unbilled bulk sale.
WARNING: Check if a 10-pack was sold but entered as 1 unit.
